Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with pair of added white bands and another white band at bottom of sherd; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreleg of seated sphinx, to left; below, handle frill pattern and double guilloche pattern between brown lines in handle zone; reserved below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number '20' is written in pen on a label glued to the interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 32, no. A. 1b, pl. 1, no. 2)
